description.narrative: The project represents a 5-year time slice of Electricity of Viet Nam's (EVN) power transmission system development plan, covering 500 kilovolt (kV) and 220 kV transmission lines and associated substations. The project will transmit power from remote power plants to the northern part of Viet Nam, which is relatively poor. This enables adequate and reliable power supply required in the planned socio-economic development activities including new industrial parks. The Project will also create the potential for regional power interconnection.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

description.narrative: Households and the industries in northern Viet Nam have access to reliable supply of electricity

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President
After Project Completion, per capita consumption of electricity increased from 130 kWh in 2005 to 250kWh

description.narrative: Households and the industries in northern Viet Nam have access to reliable supply of electricity

title.narrative: After Project Completion, transmission losses reduced from 14.7% in 2005 to 13.8% in 2013 and 11% in 2018.

description.narrative: Households and the industries in northern Viet Nam have access to reliable supply of electricity

title.narrative: After Project Completion, power outages reduced during dry season from 8 hours/day to 2 hours/day
